Ingredients.2: 12 ounces dried Calimyrna figs, coarsely chopped

Ingredients.3: 0.5 cups white whole-wheat flour (such as King Arthur®)

Ingredients.15: 0.5 teaspoon orange-vanilla flavoring (such as Fiori di Sicilia® (Optional)

Directions.1: Gently heat buttermilk and figs in a saucepan over medium-low heat until softened, 10 to 15 minutes; set aside until cool.

Directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a tube pan. Grease one side of a sheet of aluminum foil.

Directions.3: Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt together into a bowl.

Directions.4: Beat eggs in a separate, large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed for 1 minute. Add the cooled fig and buttermilk mixture, bread crumbs, melted butter, almonds, orange marmalade, orange zest, and orange-vanilla flavoring; beat on low speed until blended.

Directions.5: Gradually mix in the sifted flour mixture until just incorporated. Spoon batter into the prepared pan and cover with the greased foil.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until firm and pulling away from sides of the pan, 1 hour 15 minutes to 2 hours.

Directions.7: Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack.
